newsitem.title: USA: CME live cattle calls mixed, feeders steady to up.
newsitem.headline: CME live cattle calls mixed, feeders steady to up.

text.p: Early calls on CME live cattle futures ranged from 0.100 cent lower to 0.100 higher while feeder cattle were expected steady to 0.150 cent higher, livestock analysts said.

Some analysts anticipated carryover weakness in live cattle futures following a technical selloff after failing to set a new high Monday and a lack of direct steer trade at the expected higher price levels.
However, others look for support following stabilized beef trade and continued concern over cold weather. Packers should pay up for fed cattle soon.
Feeder cattle futures were seen showing early support following firmer fundamentals. The latest CME feeder cattle index was higher and early indications on corn futures were lower, analysts said.
The latest CME feeder cattle index was up $0.46 at $68.33 per cwt. The index has risen nearly $4 since the first of the year.
